summary: Build an informational website named “Smart Janghai,” including a modern homepage with a hero image featuring the brand name.
architectural_notes: Homepage hero image must reference the exact web-safe filename under /public/assets/generated; keep code path in sync with the actual asset name.
If adding images to the logo/branding area, ensure responsive sizing and preserve readability/spacing across common screen sizes.
Front page branding should show only one logo/mark; avoid duplicating logos across hero/logo section and other areas.
If the brand name text is replaced by a logo image, ensure accessibility: provide meaningful alt text and preserve layout/readability across breakpoints.
known_issues: Hero image not displaying due to mismatch between referenced filename (chatgpt-image-feb-14-2026-115631-am-1.png) and actual uploaded asset name (ChatGPT Image Feb 14, 2026, 11_56_31 AM.png).
Build/deploy failed with a configuration error ("Please reach out to the Caffeine team").
After latest deployment/update, the site appears blank/"nothing is showing" (possible build/runtime failure or missing render).

existing_features.title: Build the public homepage for the informational website named “Smart Janghai”, including a hero section that prominently displays the brand name “SMART JANGHAI” and a short informational tagline, plus a simple layout for additional informational sections (e.g., intro, highlights, footer).
Add and display a generated homepage hero image as a static frontend asset, stored under frontend/public/assets/generated, and use it as the hero background/primary visual on the homepage.

Apply a cohesive, modern visual theme for the Smart Janghai informational site (colors, typography, spacing, and components) and enforce it consistently across the homepage. Do not use a blue-and-purple dominant palette.

Update the HomePage top (hero) section to display the uploaded image behind the "SMART JANGHAI" logo/text at the top of the front page, preserving readability (e.g., via existing gradient overlay) across common screen sizes.

Add the newly uploaded image file "ChatGPT Image Feb 14, 2026, 11_56_31 AM-1.png" to the frontend as a static asset under "frontend/public/assets/generated" using a web-safe filename, and ensure the homepage hero references that exact filename.

Ensure the top (hero) section of the front page displays the uploaded image behind the "SMART JANGHAI" logo/text while preserving text readability across common screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop), using an overlay/gradient if needed.

Fix the HomePage hero background image so it loads correctly by making the referenced `src` path match the actual static asset filename under `frontend/public/assets/generated`, specifically the user-uploaded file "ChatGPT Image Feb 14, 2026, 11_56_31 AM.png" (use a web-safe filename in the generated assets folder and ensure `frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx` references that exact web-safe filename).

Add the user-uploaded image file "ChatGPT Image Feb 14, 2026, 12_12_09 PM.png" to the frontend as a static asset under "frontend/public/assets/generated" using a web-safe filename, and ensure the app references that exact filename.

Update the HomePage hero "logo section" (the branding area in the hero content) to display the uploaded image (from REQ-9) alongside/above the "SMART JANGHAI" text while preserving readability and responsive layout (mobile/tablet/desktop).
Fix the frontend so the Smart Janghai site reliably renders content again (no blank page) after deployment.
Remove the duplicate React Query provider setup so the app uses exactly one QueryClientProvider (keep the provider in frontend/src/main.tsx and update frontend/src/App.tsx accordingly).

Add a user-visible error fallback for unexpected render/runtime errors so the page never appears completely blank (e.g., an Error Boundary around the app that displays a simple English error message and a refresh action).

Verify the hero and logo static image asset paths are valid and do not break page rendering; ensure frontend/src/assets/generatedAssets.ts references files that exist under frontend/public/assets/generated, and make image loading resilient (do not let missing images blank the page).

Add the user-uploaded image file "LOGO.png" to the frontend as a static asset under "frontend/public/assets/generated" using a web-safe filename, and update the code to reference that exact filename for the site logo.

Update the homepage hero branding area so the front page displays only one logo/branding mark (no multiple logos). Use the uploaded logo image as the single logo displayed in the hero, and remove/avoid any additional logo images so only one logo is shown.
Add a Support section at the bottom of the website (in the footer area) that displays the contact email address "SMARTCARE01@GMAIL.COM" in English, as a clickable mailto link.
Replace the visible "SMART JANGHAI" brand-name text used for branding on the site with the existing logo image asset, so the logo image is used as the primary branding mark instead of the text.

Ensure there is only one visible branding logo mark in the hero/branding area at a time and that missing logo assets never cause a blank section or blank page (use the existing resilient image loading pattern).
Remove any visible “SMART JANGHAI” / “Smart Janghai” branding text from the UI so the site branding is logo-only (no brand-name text shown in the hero branding area or footer).

Update the BrandLogo component so that if the logo image fails to load, it does not fall back to showing the brand-name text; instead render a non-text fallback that preserves layout and does not cause a blank/empty page.

new_feature_requests.summary: Generate a modern homepage hero image concept for the Smart Janghai informational website with the brand name overlaid.
Place the provided/generated hero image behind the “SMART JANGHAI” logo/text in the top (hero) section of the front page.

Add the user-uploaded image file "ChatGPT Image Feb 14, 2026, 11_56_31 AM.png" to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated, using a web-safe filename, and ensure it is referenced consistently from the homepage hero.
Add the provided images as a sliding notification panel on the front page.
Add the provided image to the logo section of the front page (alongside/within the SMART JANGHAI branding area).
Ensure the front page displays only one logo/branding mark (remove/avoid multiple logos in the hero/branding area).
Add a Support section at the bottom of the homepage/footer area including the contact email SMARTCARE01@GMAIL.COM.
Replace the "SMART JANGHAI" brand name text in the hero/header branding area with the provided image-format logo (use the logo image in place of the text).
